body.name: Enfamil NeuroPro EnfaCare High Cal Premature Baby Formula Milk-Based with Iron, Brain-Building DHA, Vitamins & Minerals for Immune Health, 13.6 Ounce (Pack of 6)
deliveryMessages: Or fastest delivery Monday, February 19. Order within 3 hrs 54 mins
features: SUPPORTS IMMUNE SYSTEM: Milk-based, 22 Cal Fl Oz formula with enriched nutrition and a blend of nutrients to help support baby's immune system
PROMOTES CATCH-UP GROWTH: Clinically proven to promote catch-up growth similar to full-term breastfed infants
BLEND OF IMPORTANT NUTRIENTS: Enfamil Enfacare has a blend of vitamin D, omega-3 DHA and vitamin C to help support length gain and lean support
EXPERT RECOMMENDED DHA: Enfamil Enfacare has expert recommended DHA which provides brain-building nutrition
BRAIN-BUILDING NUTRITION: Get brain building nutrition inspired by breast milk from Enfamil
TRUSTED BRAND: Enfamil is the Trusted Brand for Brain-building and Immune Support
PEDIATRICIAN RECOMMENDED: Enfamil is the infant formula brand recommended by pediatricians
body.description: Introducing Enfamil NeuroPro EnfaCare, now formulated with MFGM that nourishes the brain first and meets the special nutritional needs of babies born prematurely or at a low birth weight. Emerging evidence from a recent clinical study showed MFGM in formula supports cognitive development similar to breast milk.* NeuroPro is the only formula that has a fat-protein blend of MFGM and DHA previously only found in breast milk.† Enfamil NeuroPro EnfaCare also has additional protein, calcium, and extra vitamins & minerals‡ to promote early growth & help your little one catch up to full-term, breastfed infants.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 31, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Such a good deal. We’ve ordered this formula three times now and we’ve never had an issue. Always comes in perfect condition and it’s a great value. This formula is incredibly expensive to buy in the grocery store so we’re saving A LOT by purchasing on Amazon.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 18, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars This formula is good but be forewarned about any corn syrup solid based formula (Gentlease)
reviews.reviewText: This Enfamil formula for premies and Nuero Pro as well has been good for us. BUT, be forewarned about Gentlease, any hypoallergenic or "easy to digest" formula. If their ingredient list starts with Corn Syrup Solids, our babies hate it and often spit it up. It's not that it's bad for them. Corn Syrup Solids are almost entirely glucose (i.e. NOT 1/2 fructose as is table suger (bad) or more than half fructose as in High Fructose Corn Syrup (very bad)) and glucose is good BUT this formula tastes awful and if your baby won't drink it or spits it up and makes awful faces, then what? The lesson is try it with your baby before you buy very much.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 12, 2023
reviews.reviewText: This is the formula the NICU used for our preemie baby girl.Obviously, my husband and I did want to use this since the hospital did but bought Similac as a back up. This is so hard to find online but I was able to find some at our local Giant grocery store (Stop & Shop if you're up North) and Wegmans.Per the NICU nurses, any 22cal formula will work for preemie babies!P.S: I was also able to find Pampers Preemie Diapers at Wegmans, tooAlso P.S: Your intrusive thoughts are going to tell you to smell the formula, take it from someone who listened... don't do it...

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 12, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Loved how big the cans were, definitely worth the price paid

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 12, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Para mí no...
reviews.reviewText: Esta la compré para un sobrino-nieto nuevo y mi sobrina no tuvo leche materna.En esos días hubo escasez de esa leche y la ayudé en eso, pues el bebé es comelón...Tuvimos miedo de que le faltara. Gracias a Dios todo se arregló!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 13, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Milk is good for preemies
reviews.reviewText: It’s indeed excellent for catch up growth. I’m a NICU mom who was very concerned about her baby. This milk has done my baby well. I highly recommend, although my purchase arrived damaged

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 4, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars NICU approved, beware of the gas!
reviews.reviewText: When our twins came out of the NICU it was hard to find this formula in stores (it’s still hard) but being able to buy this 4 pack in bulk was helpful especially since it was a better deal then the smaller. It even sent on sale for under $200 before prime day!My only complaint is that it’s not currently offered consistently. This has more to do with the manufacturer. But it was helpful to order these while we could!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 18, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars From 6 months breast feeding to formhla
reviews.reviewText: All the moms at my daycare use this formula when they were switching from breastfeeding to formula. My baby did wonderful transitioning, she hardly ever spits up, she’s not as gassy, has regular bowel movements and didn’t notice a difference in taste from breast milk to formula. It can be hard to purchase online as they sell out often but if you’re transitioning this is the way to go, even though it says for premature babies I found that as just a plus of added nutrients for babies continual growth. My baby went from 25-30 percentile breast feeding for 6 months to 50% on formula . She’s super healthy and has only gotten sick once and she’s in day care on this formula still as we speak.
